etymology.description: 长(long) + 城(city wall) = long wall (Great Wall).
etymology.interpretation: Literally “long wall,” a proper noun for the Great Wall of China; the modifier 长 emphasizes the wall’s great length.
etymology.simplification: The character 長 was simplified to 长 in PRC reforms to reduce strokes, influenced by cursive forms; 城 remained unchanged. The compound itself was not otherwise altered.

parts.english: long; length; lasting; for a long time

examples.chinese: 我们明天去参观长城(我們明天去參觀長城)。
examples.english: We are going to visit the Great Wall tomorrow.

examples.chinese: 长城蜿蜒穿过群山(長城蜿蜒穿過群山)。
examples.english: The Great Wall winds through the mountains.

examples.chinese: 长城是中国古代的防御工程(長城是中國古代的防禦工程)。
examples.pinyin: Chángchéng shì Zhōngguó gǔdài de fángyù gōngchéng.
examples.english: The Great Wall is an ancient Chinese defensive project.
